thread.title: Everton boss Ronald Koeman makes shock Wayne Rooney transfer admission
thread.title_full: Everton boss Ronald Koeman makes shock Wayne Rooney transfer admission

title: Everton boss Ronald Koeman makes shock Wayne Rooney transfer admission
text:
Everton boss Ronald Koeman makes shock Wayne Rooney transfer admission RONALD KOEMAN has admitted he would welcome Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney back at Everton. PUBLISHED: 09:14, Tue, Feb 28, 2017 | UPDATED: 09:53, Tue, Feb 28, 2017 GETTY Ronald Koeman thinks Wayne Rooney would improve his Everton side 
Wayne Rooney has fallen down the pecking order at Manchester United this season since the arrival of Zlatan Ibrahimovic. 
The United skipper has made just eight Premier League starts for Jose Mourinho's side and has been linked with a big-money move to China in the summer. 
However, the 31-year-old has also been tipped to return to Everton where he began his career in 2002. GETTY Wayne Rooney started his career with Everton 
And Toffees boss Ronald Koeman has admitted he would welcome the return of the England international who he thinks could improve his side. 
"I believe that Wayne Rooney is still playing at a high level," Koeman told Sky Sports. 
"I think he made a good choice to stay at Manchester United and in the Premier League because he has still two or three years in front of him to play on a high level. Superstar strikers who could replace Wayne Rooney at Man United Tue, February 21, 2017
